title: Appropriate subjects for investigation
context: ยง96-8 Appropriate subjects for investigation. An appropriate subject for investigation is an administrative act of an agency which might be: (1) Contrary to law; (2) Unreasonable, unfair, oppressive, or unnecessarily discriminatory, even though in accordance with law; (3) Based on a mistake of fact; (4) Based on improper or irrelevant grounds; (5) Unaccompanied by an adequate statement of reasons; (6) Performed in an inefficient manner; or (7) Otherwise erroneous. The ombudsman may investigate to find an appropriate remedy. [L 1967, c 306, ยง9; HRS ยง96-8]
